dc:description: Large fragment of multi-colored woven wool fabric.  The warp is 2-ply unevenly dyed green.  The main weft is 4-ply unevenly dyed green.  There is a supplementary weft that may have been used for tufts (or loops).  These supplementary wefts are in four colors; red, yellow/green, light brown/gold and dark brown/red.  The yellow/green may be a natural yarn with green dye that has bled into it.  There are several random stitches of coarse linen yarn.  A thinner linen yarn was used to attach two small fragments of brown woven wool fabric.  The larger fragment has purple bands and tapestry patterning as follows:
tapestry band with   4 picks of purple at top and bottom and purple tapestry with brown background    1.7 cm
The other attached fragment is balanced plain weave.
